oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Doss family with hens
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Mr. and Mrs. Jess Doss, of Lawrenceburg, Tenn., in front of wood logs, with five children and hens. Mrs. Doss is holding a bowl filled with chicken eggs. All the children are dressed up for the picture. Mr. Doss wears overalls.
The first family in Lawrence County to enroll in the program. They rented 30 acres of land for cotton, corn and sweet potatoes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Agricultural resources; Food supply; Food relief; Food supply--History; Food supply--United States; Food supply--Government policy--United States; Overalls; World War, 1939-1945--Food supply; Eggs
